message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.DC 

This paper deals with the problem of optimal forwarding in a delay tolerant network, which is a type of network that is characterized by intermittent connectivity and long delays. The paper focuses on the trade-off between delivery delay and energy consumption, which are important considerations in such networks. The problem is formulated as a controlled continuous time Markov chain, which is a common modeling framework in networking research. The paper also uses an ODE approximation to address the issue of imperfect knowledge of the system state. Based on these observations, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.SY (Systems and Control), cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), and cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing).
